meanings.definition: A space left at the beginning of a line of text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked us to use indents in our essays for better organization.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to include proper indents in your document to make it look neat.
meanings.sent3: I forgot to add the indents in my assignment, and it looked like a jumbled mess.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting had indents that resembled tiny valleys on the paper.
meanings.sent5: The indents in the book made it easier to follow each paragraph.

meanings.definition: A notch or recess in a surface.
meanings.sent1: The old tree had deep indents on its bark from years of growth.
meanings.sent2: The car's door had an indent from where it was hit by a ball.
meanings.sent3: She found an indent in the sand that looked like a heart shape.
meanings.sent4: The indent in the wall held a hidden treasure behind it.
meanings.sent5: The indent in the rock provided a perfect spot for a small plant to grow.

meanings.definition: To form deep recesses or notches in.
meanings.sent1: The sculptor carefully indents the clay to create intricate patterns.
meanings.sent2: You can indent the wood to give it a more artistic look.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally indents his phone screen by pressing too hard.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain can indent the soft ground, leaving marks behind.
meanings.sent5: The hammer indents the metal, shaping it into a beautiful sculpture.
